terrain_conditions: Bardia fortress - coastal escarpment, defensive positions
weather_impact: Mild winter weather favorable for operations. Division destroyed at Bardia 5 January 1941 during British-Australian assault.

combat_status.notes: Division destroyed at Battle of Bardia (3-5 Jan 1941). Mauled at Tummar camps (9-11 Dec 1940), retreated to Bardia (11-16 Dec), besieged 16 Dec-3 Jan, destroyed by Australian 6th Division assault. Commander Tracchia captured. ~12,000 Italian troops POW.

historical_notes.operation_compass: Division participated in September 1940 invasion of Egypt. Defended Tummar camps against British Operation Compass (9-11 Dec 1940) - positions overrun. Fighting retreat to Bardia under British air attack (11-16 Dec). Besieged in Bardia fortress 16 Dec 1940 - 3 Jan 1941. British-Australian assault 3 Jan - perimeter breached by Matilda tanks. Division destroyed 5 Jan 1941. Not reformed.
historical_notes.destruction: Battle of Bardia (3-5 January 1941): Division destroyed by Australian 6th Division with Matilda tank support. 47mm anti-tank guns ineffective against Matilda armor. Artillery overwhelmed. Division surrendered 5 Jan - approximately 12,000 POW including commander Tracchia.

sources.name: Battle of Bardia - Wikipedia, Australian War Memorial

notes: Division destroyed 5 January 1941 at Bardia - not reformed
Q1 1941 TO&E reflects pre-destruction strength (early January)
Personnel and equipment reduced from Tummar losses and retreat casualties
Commander Ruggero Tracchia commanded 28 May 1940 - 5 Jan 1941 (captured)
Supply situation critical during siege: 3 days fuel, 6 days ammunition, 2 days water
